item.title: Dorothy Bishop
item.description:
This is intended as serious question for #neuroscience Mastodon, not as snark.
Re neuroscience biomarkers of individual differences.
Are there any findings of significant correlations between:
a) fMRI activation in a given ROI
b) A cognitive/emotional/behavioural phenotype
that have been replicated by a different research group?
I'm also interested in same question where (a) is an EEG/ERP component.
And in both clinical and nonclinical samples.
Thanks!
#biomarkers #replication #phenotype

item.title: Manlio De Domenico
item.description: I am not a fan of IIT, but to be honest it seems that a tribal fight is ongoing.As a scientist, I have seen (and am still seeing) some speculations in magazines, top journals (as opinion pieces), in social media for a variety of topics, from quantum mechanics to Complex systems. It might be disappointing, but it's what it is.To claim that one theory is pseudoscience (even if it is), at least I'd expect to have a special issue in some domain journal, with peer reviewed papers that highlights both strength and weaknesses of the alternative theories and the attacked one (represented by distinct groups). We need to support each claim with papers, not (only) posts on Twitter, blogs, preprints, etc.Polítics, publish or perish mindset, egocentrism, etc etc are intoxicating science. We have the duty to use the scientific method every time, at each step. We shouldn't forget it. Not defending IIT today. But if we are fine with today's tribal fight then we must be ready to face hard times in the future.

item.title: Albert Cardona
item.description: For anyone in the infosec community: does the DuckDuckGo app tracking protection work as advertised?https://duckduckgo.com/duckduckgo-help-pages/p-app-tracking-protection/what-is-app-tracking-protection/Claims to be a local VPN through which all app traffic is routed, and the data doesn't leave the phone. Upon activating it, I see it claiming to have intercepted lots of attempts at tracking from various apps, listing blocked items such as postal code, local IP address, network carrier, and the like, plus much worse ones like name, email, advertising ID and others.(The good part is it's only 4 apps doing all of the tracking and I can – and did – delete them.)#duckduckgo #Android #infosec

item.title: Helen Jackson
item.description:
In "we can adapt" news:
• 1998: cracks reported in dams
• 2011: project to fix them halted
• budget allocated to fix them every year since but nothing done
• 2021: audit bureau criticises procrastination
• 2022: engineer warns of catastrophePeople who say that adaptation is cheap and easy and will somehow just happen automatically are wrong. It requires sustained political will to overcome the in-built tendency not to act to mitigate serious risks which haven't yet materialised.https://www.middleeasteye.net/news/libya-burst-dams-had-decades-old-cracks-says-official

item.title: Spencer LaVere Smith
item.description: @kevinbolding Pixel throughput is much higher with 1p. More pixels + faster framerate— might be critical for fast signals like GluSnFR. Price is low; 50k - 100k USD lower— no laser. So scaling up to multiple rigs is much more feasible. It’s possible to go completely wireless — no tether — with 1p (not yet possible for 2p). MINI2p photonic fiber designed for just one wavelength. 1p imaging can do multiple excitation colors.Integration with optogenetic stimulation is easier in 1p.
